body_html:
@pfllo why do you want to accumulate sparse gradients and then add them to a dense variable? Why not having one call of the optimizer per iteration?

@MohammadSamragh you can use a dense variable to store the weights and have efficient code if your gradients are sparse (and stored as indexedslices). What op is producing these gradients as SparseTensors which require a mask?
